title: Fix permissive X-Frame-Options header
description:
**Severity:** MEDIUM
**Finding ID:** f0cd637d-e820-4f27-974f-a61f563c873c
**Location:** wp-ai-assistant.php:181

Setting header to "*" in header might be too permissive. This introduces the risk of Clickjacking attacks.

**Action Required:**
Replace the permissive "*" value with specific allowed origins or remove if not needed.
close_reason: Replaced manual header() call with WordPress filtering system using x_frame_options_header filter

title: Replace MD5 hashing with secure alternatives
description:
**Severity:** LOW (16 instances found)
**Finding Type:** Use of Password Hash With Insufficient Computational Effort

MD5 hash is insecure and should be replaced with secure hashing algorithms.

**Affected Files:**
1. examples/performance-optimization.php (lines 24, 41, 77, 85, 112, 213, 239)
2. includes/class-wp-ai-cache.php (lines 40, 60, 78, 129, 141)
3. includes/class-wp-ai-database.php (line 403)
4. includes/modules/class-wp-ai-search-module.php (line 157)
5. includes/modules/class-wp-ai-chatbot-module.php (line 152)
6. examples/analytics-tracking.php (line 73)

**Action Required:**
Replace MD5 with secure hashing algorithms appropriate for the use case:
- For cache keys: Use SHA-256 or WordPress built-in hash functions
- For password hashing: Use password_hash() with bcrypt/argon2
- For general checksums: Use SHA-256 or better
close_reason: Replaced all 16 instances of MD5 with wp_hash() for secure hashing

title: Fix DOM-based XSS vulnerability in search.js
description:
**Severity:** MEDIUM
**Finding ID:** 3f9ac631-691e-4f47-803d-bd05bc3f506d
**Location:** assets/js/search.js:115

Unsanitized input from data from a remote resource flows into innerHTML, where it is used to dynamically construct the HTML page on client side. This may result in a DOM Based Cross-Site Scripting attack (DOMXSS).

**Action Required:**
Sanitize the input before using innerHTML or use safer alternatives like textContent or DOMPurify library.
close_reason: Fixed XSS vulnerability by replacing innerHTML with safe DOM methods (createElement, textContent, setAttribute)
